PageInfo.description: Provides information about the pagination of a dataset.

endCursor.description: The cursor that points to the end of the current page, or null if there is no such cursor.

hasNextPage.description: Indicates if there is another page after the current page.

hasPreviousPage.description: Indicates if there is a page before the current page.

startCursor.description: The cursor that points to the start of the current page, or null if there is no such cursor.

id.description: The unique identifier for the audit.

customerOrganizationName.description: The domain name of the customer organization being audited (e.g. vanta.com)

customerDisplayName.description: The human readable name of the customer organization being audited (e.g. Vanta)

customerOrganizationId.description: The uuid of the customer organization being audited

auditStartDate.description: The start of the audit window. This is also when data collection for audit starts.

auditEndDate.description: The end of the audit window.

earlyAccessStartsAt.description: Timestamp at which auditors gain access to the audit. Occurs before the audit window begins

framework.description: The name of the framework for the audit

displayName.description:
The display name for the audit. Returns the custom audit name if set,
otherwise returns the framework name.

allowAuditorEmails.description: Emails of auditors with access to audit

allowAllAuditors.description: Set to true if all auditors in audit firm have access

deletionDate.description: Timestamp when the audit was deleted

creationDate.description: Timestamp when the audit was created

modificationDate.description: Timestamp when the audit was updated

completionDate.description: Timestamp when the audit was marked completed, and report was uploaded

auditFocus.description: Audit focus determines if the audit is internal or external facing

requestsSharedWithCustomer.description: Timestamp when information requests were shared with the customer. Null if not shared.

auditorRequestListMetadata.description:
Metadata about the auditor request list. This field is only present for IRL (Information
Request List) based audits and will be undefined for standard audits. Use the presence
of this field to differentiate between IRL and non-IRL audits.

ListAuditsPageSize.description:
Controls the maximum number of items returned in one response from the listAudits API.

We have increased the pagination size for this endpoint to enable our upmarket audit firms to
sync in a timely manner. The rest of the API will use a pagination size of 100.

PageCursor.description:
A marker or pointer, telling the API where to start fetching items for the subsequent page in a paginated dataset.
Note that the requested page will not include the item that corresponds to this cursor but will start from the one immediately
after this cursor.

VendorAuthenticationMethod.description:
The authentication method a vendor uses:
- AUTH_0: The vendor authenticates using Auth0
- AZURE_AD: The vendor authenticates using Azure Active Directory
- G_SUITE: The vendor authenticates using Google Workspace
- O_AUTH: The vendor authenticates using OAuth
- O365: The vendor authenticates using Office 365
- OKTA: The vendor authenticates using Okta
- ONE_LOGIN: The vendor authenticates using OneLogin
- OWA: The vendor authenticates using OWA
- SSO: The vendor authenticates using SSO
- USERNAME_PASSWORD: The vendor authenticates using usernames and passwords

VendorStatus.description:
The current state of a vendor:
- MANAGED: The vendor is actively managed.
- ARCHIVED: The vendor has been archived
- IN_PROCUREMENT: The vendor is in the procurement process

VendorRiskLevel.description:
The risk level of a vendor:
- CRITICAL: The vendor has a critical security risk
- HIGH: The vendor has a high security risk
- MEDIUM: The vendor has a medium security risk
- LOW: The vendor has a low security risk
- UNSCORED: The vendor has not been given a risk level

id.description: The vendor's unique ID.

accountManagerName.description: The vendor's external account manager name.

accountManagerEmail.description: The vendor's external account manager email.

additionalNotes.description: Any additional notes about the vendor

securityOwnerUserId.description: The vendor's security owner's Vanta user ID.

businessOwnerUserId.description: The vendor's business owner's Vanta user ID.

contractStartDate.description: The date the contract with the vendor began.

contractRenewalDate.description: The date the contract with the vendor is up for renewal.

contractTerminationDate.description: The date the contract with the vendor was terminated.

nextSecurityReviewDueDate.description: The next due date for a security review.

lastSecurityReviewCompletionDate.description: The most recent date a security review was completed.

isVisibleToAuditors.description: Whether or not auditors can view this vendor.

isRiskAutoScored.description: Whether or not the vendor's risk is automatically scored.

riskAttributeIds.description: The list of risk attribute IDs the vendor has been assigned to.

passwordMinimumLength.description: Minimum number for chacters required for passwords for this vendor.

passwordRequiresSymbol.description: Whether or not the vendor requires passwords to have a symbol.

passwordRequiresNumber.description: Whether or not the vendor requires passwords to have a number.

passwordMFA.description: Whether or not the vendor requires passwords to have multi factor authentication.

contractAmount.description: The contract amount for the vendor.

latestDecision.description: The vendor's latest decision status. Null means no decision has been made.

linkedTaskTrackerTaskProcurementRequest.description: The task tracker procurement request associated with this vendor (if linked).

PageSize.description: Controls the maximum number of items returned in one response from the API.

ComputerStatusOutcome.description:
The possible outcomes of a status check. The outcome can be one of the following:
FAIL:  The check is failing.
IN_PROGRESS: The check needs further data from the given computer in order to evaluate. The field(s) needed from a computer to calculate the ComputerStatusOutcome were null.
NA: The check is not applicable for the given computer.
PASS: The check is passing.

ComputerStatus.description: The a status check for a computer. Representation for screenlock, diskEncryption, passwordManager, and antivirusInstallation.

outcome.description: The outcome of the status check.

OperatingSystemType.description: The possible types of the operating system. One of `mac_OS`, `linux`, or `windows`.

OperatingSystem.description: The computer's operating system type and version.

type.description: The type of the operating system.

version.description: The version of the operating system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the person.

displayName.description: Name of the person that is shown in product.

id.description: Unique identifier for the monitored computer.

integrationId.description: Hard-coded enums for Vanta-built integrations or application IDs for 3rd-party-built integrations.

lastCheckDate.description: Date of the computer's most recent report.

screenlock.description: Whether or not the computer has screenlock enabled.

diskEncryption.description: Whether or not the computer's hard drive is encrypted.

passwordManager.description: Whether or not the computer has a password manager installed.

antivirusInstallation.description: Whether or not the computer has antivirus software installed.

operatingSystem.description: The computer's operating system name and version.

owner.description: The name, unique identifier, and email address of the computer's owner.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the computer. This value may be null if it is not reported by the device.

udid.description: The universal device id of the computer.

ComputerStatusFilter.description:
Enum representing computer compliance statuses that can be utilized as a filter. The meanings are as follows:
AV_NOT_INSTALLED: The computer does not have antivirus software installed.
HD_NOT_ENCRYPTED: The computer's harddrive is not encrypted.
LAST_CHECK_OVER_14_DAYS: No data has been received from computer for over 14 days.
PWM_NOT_INSTALLED: The computer does not have a password manager installed.
SCREENLOCK_NOT_CONFIGURED: The computer does not have screenlock configured appropriately.

id.description: Vanta internal reference to evidence

isDownloadable.description: Set to true if this is a presigned s3 url. Set to false if this is a customer uploaded link

mimeType.description: MIME type of the evidence file (e.g., "application/pdf", "image/png")

EmploymentStatus.description:
The employment status of a person:
- UPCOMING: The person is not yet employed and will start employment in the future.
- CURRENT: The person is currently employed.
- ON_LEAVE: The person is on leave.
- INACTIVE: The person's employment is inactive.
- FORMER: The person was previously employed.

LeaveStatus.description: User can be active or upcoming leave period

startDate.description: The start of the person's leave.

endDate.description: The end of the person's leave. Null endDate implies indefinite leave.

status.description: ACTIVE if the leave is currently ongoing. UPCOMING if the startDate is in the future.

VantaBasedPersonInfoSource.description: The person's information comes from what is set in Vanta.

ScimBasedPersonInfoSource.description: The person's information comes from SCIM.

IntegrationBasedPersonInfoSource.description: The person's information comes from an integration.

PersonInfoSource.description: The source of the person's information.

TasksSummaryStatus.description:
The overall status of a person's outstanding tasks:
- NONE: There are no tasks.
- DUE_SOON: At least one task is due soon.
- OVERDUE: At least one task is overdue. Has a higher priority than DUE_SOON.
- COMPLETE: All tasks are complete.
- PAUSED: All tasks are paused.
- OFFBOARDING_DUE_SOON: At least one offboarding task is due soon.
- OFFBOARDING_OVERDUE: At least one offboarding task is overdue. Has a higher priority than OFFBOARDING_DUE_SOON.
- OFFBOARDING_COMPLETE: All offboarding tasks are complete.

TaskType.description:
The type a task summary falls into.
COMPLETE_TRAININGS: The task summary containing security trainings.
ACCEPT_POLICIES: The task summary containing policy acceptance.
COMPLETE_CUSTOM_TASKS: The task summary containing custom tasks.
INSTALL_DEVICE_MONITORING: The task summary containing device monitoring installation.
COMPLETE_BACKGROUND_CHECKS: The task summary containing background checks.

TaskStatus.description:
The status of a task.
- COMPLETE: The task has been completed.
- DUE_SOON: The task is due soon.
- OVERDUE: The task is overdue.
- NONE: The task is not assigned.

CompleteTrainingsTaskSummary.description: Task summary for completing all trainings.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

completionDate.description: The date the task was completed.

disabled.description: If the task is disabled, the reason and date when it was disabled.

incompleteTrainings.description: Incomplete security trainings that are relevant given a person's requirements.

completedTrainings.description: Security trainings that have been completed and are relevant given a person's current requirements.

AcceptPoliciesTaskSummary.description: Policy acceptance details for a person.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

completionDate.description: The date the task was completed.

disabled.description: If the task is disabled, the reason and date when it was disabled.

unacceptedPolicies.description: Unaccepted policies that are relevant to the person.

acceptedPolicies.description: Accepted policies that are relevant to the person.

CompleteCustomTasksTaskSummary.description: Task summary for completing all custom tasks.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

completionDate.description: The date the task was completed.

disabled.description: If the task is disabled, the reason and date when it was disabled.

incompleteCustomTasks.description: Incomplete custom tasks that are relevant given a person's requirements.

completedCustomTasks.description: Custom tasks that have been completed and are relevant given a person's current requirements.

CompleteOffboardingCustomTasksTaskSummar.description: Task summary for completing all offboarding custom tasks.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

completionDate.description: The date the task was completed.

disabled.description: If the task is disabled, the reason and date when it was disabled.

incompleteCustomOffboardingTasks.description: Incomplete custom tasks that are relevant given a person's requirements.

completedCustomOffboardingTasks.description: Custom tasks that have been completed and are relevant given a person's current requirements.

InstallDeviceMonitoringTaskSummary.description: Task summary for installing device monitoring.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

completionDate.description: The date the task was completed.

disabled.description: If the task is disabled, the reason and date when it was disabled.

CompleteBackgroundChecksTaskSummary.description: Task summary for completing background checks.

dueDate.description: The due date of the task.

completionDate.description: The date the task was completed.

disabled.description: If the task is disabled, the reason and date when it was disabled.

TaskSummaryDetails.description: All detailed information about a person's tasks, split across task categories.

startDate.description: The date the person's employment started.

endDate.description: If present, the date the person's employment ended.

leaveInfo.description: If present, the user's active/upcoming leave. Empty if the user has no active/upcoming leave.

groupIds.description: The id of each group the user belongs to. This includes both manually created groups in Vanta and groups imported from an identity provider.

display.description: The person's display name, used in Vanta.

endDate.description: The source of the person's employment end date.

startDate.description: The source of the person's employment start date.

emailAddress.description: The source of the person's email address.

sources.description: The sources of the person's information.

status.description: The status of the person's tasks summary.

dueDate.description: The due date of the person's earliest-due task.

completionDate.description: The date when person's tasks were completed.

tasksSummary.description:
The person's tasks summary, which aggregates their current status across
all of their relevant tasks.

vulnerabilityId.description: Unique identifier for the vulnerability that the remediation is for.

vulnerableAssetId.description: Unique identifier for the vulnerable asset that the remediation is for.

detectedDate.description: Date when the vulnerability was first detected.

slaDeadlineDate.description: Date when the vulnerability should be remediated by.

remediationDate.description: Date when the vulnerability was remediated.

ExternalFindingSeverity.description: ExternalFindingSeverity describes the severity of an external finding (Vulnerability or Security Alert)

sectionNames.description: A list sections associated to the control

externalId.description: This is a static UUID to map Audit Firm controls to Vanta controls

status.description: Vanta internal statuses for audit evidence

deletionDate.description: The date this Audit Evidence was deleted

creationDate.description: The date this Audit Evidence was created

statusUpdatedDate.description: Point in time that status was last updated

testStatus.description: The outcome of the automated test run, for Test-type evidence

relatedControls.description: The controls associated to this evidence

auditEvidenceId.description: The unique identifier for the audit evidence related to the comment.

email.description: The email of the comment author. This acts as a unique identifier to map users between Vanta and external systems.

authorName.description:
Human-readable display name of the comment author.
Null if the author's name is not available (e.g., user was deleted).
This enables correct author attribution in integrations where users cannot
be reliably matched across systems by email alone.

id.description: The control's unique ID.

domains.description: The security domains that the control belongs to.

role.description: The control's GDPR role, if the control is a GDPR control.

customFields.description: The control's custom field values, if control custom fields is included in your Vanta instance.

creationDate.description: When the control was created. Returns null for Vanta library controls.

modificationDate.description: When the control was last modified. Returns null for Vanta library controls.

framework.description: The report standard framework fulfilled by the control.

sections.description: Sections of a framework that this control satisfies

auditorEmail.description: Email of the auditor who changed the state

id.description: Internal id of the custom evidence request within Vanta

controlIds.description: A set of controls, referenced by id, to map the evidence to

reminderWindow.description: Duration representing when to send notifications, relative to renewal date

isRestricted.description: Whether this document contains sensitive data and needs more restrictive read access

externalId.description: The external id of the control.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the control.

category.description: The category of the control. See the ControlDomain enum for possible values.

sections.description: Framework sections that the control should be mapped to.

id.description: Unique identifier for the vulnerability.

integrationId.description: Integration that the vulnerability is scanned by.

packageIdentifier.description:
Identifier for the package that the vulnerability is found on.
Only relevant to vulnerabilities of type COMMON or GROUPED.

vulnerabilityType.description:
Type of the vulnerability.
Possible values: CONFIGURATION, COMMON, GROUPED.

targetId.description: Unique identifier for the underlying resource that the vulnerability is found on.

firstDetectedDate.description: Date when the vulnerability was first detected by Vanta.

sourceDetectedDate.description: Date when the vulnerability was first detected by the source.

lastDetectedDate.description: Date when the vulnerability was last detected.

severity.description:
Severity of the vulnerability.
Possible values: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, CRITICAL.

cvssSeverityScore.description: CVSS severity score of the vulnerability.

remediateByDate.description: Date when the vulnerability should be remediated by.

relatedVulns.description:
Related vulnerabilities.
Only relevant to vulnerabilities of type GROUPED.

scanSource.description: Scanning tool that detected the vulnerability

isVulnDeactivatedIndefinitely.description: Whether the vulnerability is deactivated indefinitely.

deactivatedUntilDate.description: Date when the vulnerability will be reactivated.

deactivatedOnDate.description: Date when the vulnerability was deactivated.

deactivatedBy.description: Identifier of the user who deactivated the vulnerability.

deactivateMetadata.description: Metadata for the deactivation of the vulnerability.

resourceId.description: The scanned asset's Vanta resource id.

integrationId.description: Integration that the the vulnerable asset is scanned by.

imageDigest.description: Digest of the scanned container image.

imagePushedAtDate.description: Push date of the scanned container image.

imageTags.description: Tags of the scanned container image.

parentAccountOrOrganization.description: The parent account or organization of the scanned asset.

biosUuid.description: BIOS UUID of the scanned asset.

macAddresses.description: Mac addresses of the scanned asset.

hostnames.description: Host names of the scanned asset.

operatingSystems.description: Operating systems of the scanned asset.

id.description: Unique identifier for the vulnerable asset.

name.description: Display name of the vulnerable asset.

assetType.description:
Type of the vulnerable asset.
Possible values: CODE_REPOSITORY, CONTAINER_REPOSITORY, CONTAINER_REPOSITORY_IMAGE, MANIFEST_FILE, SERVER, SERVERLESS_FUNCTION, WORKSTATION.

hasBeenScanned.description: Whether the vulnerable asset has been scanned.

imageScanTag.description: Only relevant for container repositories. This field sets the container image tag that vulnerabilities will be retrieved for. If null, the latest image will be retrieved.

scanners.description: The integrations that are scanning this vulnerable asset.

PersonnelGroup.description:
A group record from the personnel population.
Available fields may vary based on audit view settings.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the group.
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

name.description:
Display name of the group.
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

members.description:
Number of people in this group within the audit scope.
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

source.description:
The source of this group. For IDP-synced groups, this is the provider name
(e.g., "Okta", "Azure AD"). For manually created groups, this is "Vanta".
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

tasks.description:
Names of security tasks enabled for this group.
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

tasksLastUpdated.description:
When the group's task configuration was last updated.
ISO 8601 format.
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

pointOfContact.description:
Display name of the group's designated point of contact.
Visible in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

taskSet.description:
Name of the task set (checklist) assigned to this group.
Visible in Full Audit View only.

lastRefreshedFromIdp.description:
When the group was last synced from the identity provider.
ISO 8601 format.
Visible in Full Audit View only.

PeopleEmploymentStatus.description: Employment status filter for people queries.

PeopleSourceInfo.description:
Source information for a person's data.
Full Audit View only.

PeopleTaskStatusInfo.description:
Overall task status information for a person.
Full Audit View only.

dueDate.description: Due date for the earliest incomplete task in ISO 8601 format.

completionDate.description: Completion date when all tasks are complete in ISO 8601 format.

PeopleSecurityTaskStatus.description: Security task status for individual task categories.

PeopleSecurityTaskDetails.description:
Security task details for a specific task category.
Full Audit View only.

dueDate.description: Due date for incomplete task in ISO 8601 format.

completionDate.description: Completion date for completed task in ISO 8601 format.

PersonnelPerson.description:
Personnel person data with Controlled Audit View schema.

Only `id` is required - all other fields are optional to support:
1. Controlled audits where only approved fields are returned
2. Future customizable field visibility

This prevents breaking changes when users customize visible fields.

id.description: User ID - always present.

name.description:
Display name of the person - always present.
Available in controlled audits.

email.description:
Email address of the person - always present.
Available in controlled audits.

jobTitle.description:
Job title from HR system.
Available in controlled audits.

employmentStatus.description:
Employment status.
Available in controlled audits.

startDate.description:
Start date in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Timezone depends on source: UTC if from HR system,
customer timezone if manually entered.
Available in controlled audits.

endDate.description:
End date in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Empty/null if currently employed.
Available in controlled audits.

groups.description:
Array of group names (roles) the person belongs to.
Includes both manual groups and IDP-synced groups.
Available in controlled audits.

source.description:
Source of user data.
Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

taskStatus.description:
Overall task status information.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

lastReminded.description:
Last date user was sent an onboarding reminder email in ISO 8601 format.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

policies.description:
Policy acceptance task details.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

trainings.description:
Security training task details.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

backgroundChecks.description:
Background check task details.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

deviceMonitoring.description:
Device monitoring task details.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

customOnboarding.description:
Custom onboarding task details.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

customOffboarding.description:
Custom offboarding task details.
Available in Full Audit View only - not available in Controlled Audit View.

AccountAccessService.description:
An account access service (identity provider, access credential, or external application)
connected to the organization.

These represent credentials for integrations like Okta, Azure AD,
Google Workspace, etc. that provide identity and access management
data for personnel, as well as external applications that provide
received user accounts.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service.

credentialDisplayName.description: Display name of the service shown to users.

service.description: The service name or integration ID.

subAccountId.description: Optional sub-account identifier for multi-account integrations.

AccountAccessServicesResponse.description: Response containing the list of connected account access services.

services.description: List of connected account access services.

AccountAccessStatus.description:
Account status values for account access records.
Unified status enum that covers all service types.

AccountAccess.description:
Account access record from personnel population.

This unified interface represents account access data from all service types:
- IDP services (Okta, Azure AD, Google Workspace, etc.)
- First-party account services (AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud, etc.)
- Role grants services (GCP, Azure role grants)
- Received/third-party applications

Available fields may vary based on audit view settings (Full Audit View vs Controlled Audit View).
Only `id` and `accountName` are always present - all other fields are optional to support CAV filtering.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the account.
Always present in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

accountName.description:
Account name or email address (primary identifier).
Always present in both Full Audit View and Controlled Audit View.

owner.description:
Display name of the account owner.
Available in Controlled Audit View.

role.description:
Account roles (always an array when present).
Available in Controlled Audit View.

status.description:
Account status.
Available in Controlled Audit View.

mfa.description:
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) status.
`true` = MFA enabled, `false` = MFA not enabled, `undefined` = unknown.
Available in Controlled Audit View.

createdDate.description:
Account creation date.
Available in Controlled Audit View.

deactivatedDate.description:
Account deactivation date.
Available in Controlled Audit View.

InformationRequestApprovalStatus.description:
Current approval status of the information request, tracking its lifecycle through the audit process.

The status progresses through the workflow: initial state  awaiting review  approved or flagged.
Status can move between awaiting review and flagged states as evidence is reviewed and resubmitted.

InformationRequestCadence.description: Frequency cadence for the information request, indicating how often it recurs.

InformationRequestType.description:
Type of information request, defining what scope of evidence is needed.

- POINT_IN_TIME: Evidence for a specific moment (e.g., current state of a policy)
- POPULATION: Evidence covering all items in a category (e.g., all employees)
- SAMPLE: Evidence for a representative sample (e.g., 10 random customer records)

ResourceOwner.description: Represents either a user or a team owning a resource.

InformationRequest.description:
Information Request resource representing a single request for audit evidence from a customer.

An information request is created by an auditor and shared with the customer organization.
The customer then uploads evidence, which the auditor reviews and either approves or flags
for issues.

id.description:
The unique identifier for the information request within Vanta's system.
This is the primary identifier used in all API endpoints.
Format: ObjectId as a string (e.g., "6890e473dce1da5d8406f5e7")

uniqueId.description:
External unique ID to prevent duplicates across different audit systems.
Used for idempotency when syncing data between external audit management
systems and Vanta. Unlike `id`, this value is provided by the external system.

additionalControlIds.description:
Additional control IDs beyond those automatically mapped from framework codes.
Allows manual association with specific controls when automatic mapping
is insufficient. Each ID should reference a valid control in your audit framework.

approvalStatus.description:
Current approval status tracking the request's lifecycle through evidence
submission and auditor review.

cadence.description:
How frequently this information request recurs (e.g., annual password
policy reviews). Null for one-time requests.

frameworkCodes.description:
The framework codes this request addresses.
Links the request to specific compliance requirements. Can be an empty array
if no framework codes are associated. These codes correspond to standards like SOC 2, ISO 27001, etc.

description.description:
Detailed description explaining what evidence is needed and why.
Should provide clear instructions to help the customer understand what
to submit.

dueDate.description:
The deadline by which the customer must fulfill this request.
Null if no specific deadline is set. Format: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp.

evidenceCaptureDate.description:
The earliest date for which evidence should be captured.
Evidence dated before this date may not be accepted.
Null if not restricted. Format: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp.

requestId.description:
Non-unique external reference ID for this request.
Unlike `uniqueId` which must be unique, `requestId` is for display/reference
purposes only (e.g., "REQ-123"). Null if not provided.

requestType.description: Defines the scope of evidence required.

title.description: Short, descriptive title summarizing what is being requested.

creationDate.description:
Timestamp when the request was created in the system.
Format: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp.

modificationDate.description:
Timestamp when the request was last modified.
Format: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp.

deletionDate.description:
Timestamp when the request was soft-deleted. Null if the request has not
been deleted. Soft deletes allow retaining history while hiding the request
from normal operations.
Format: ISO 8601 UTC timestamp.

ownerAssignment.description:
Resource owner (user or team) assigned to this information request.
Returns null if no resource owner is assigned.

CreateInformationRequestInput.description:
Input for creating a new information request.
New requests are created in an initial state by default.

uniqueId.description:
External unique ID to prevent duplicate requests across audit systems.
Must be unique within the audit. Used for idempotency.

title.description:

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all information requests for an audit, enabling
external audit management systems to display and track evidence requests.

This endpoint always includes soft-deleted records (where `deletionDate !== null`).
Clients should check the `deletionDate` field to identify and handle deleted records
appropriately in their systems.

This endpoint supports delta synchronization via the `changedSinceDate` parameter,
allowing efficient polling for changes without retrieving the entire dataset.

Pagination usage:
1. Make initial request with desired `pageSize`
2. Check `results.pageInfo.hasNextPage` to see if more data exists
3. If true, use `results.pageInfo.endCursor` as `pageCursor` in next request
4. Repeat until `hasNextPage` is false

Delta sync usage:
1. Store the timestamp of your last sync
2. Pass that timestamp as `changedSinceDate`
3. Only requests created, modified, or deleted since that timestamp are returned
4. Process updates and soft-deletes by checking the `deletionDate` field
5. Update your last sync timestamp to the current time
get.summary: List information requests for an audit

- Retrieving deleted requests via `changedSinceDate` for synchronization

- Evidence addresses all specified framework codes

post.description:
Flags evidence for an information request when it doesn't meet audit requirements,
marking issues that need to be addressed before approval. This action changes the
request's approvalStatus to a flagged state and creates an activity log entry.

Flagging workflow:
1. Auditor reviews submitted evidence
2. If issues are found, auditor calls this endpoint with detailed reason
3. Request status changes to flagged state
4. Customer is notified and can see the reason in activity logs
5. Customer addresses issues and updates evidence
6. When ready, customer changes status back to awaiting review
7. Auditor reviews again and either flags again or accepts

The `reason` field should clearly explain what's missing or incorrect so the
customer knows exactly what to fix. This reason is visible to the customer
and appears in the activity log.
